segment.source: Customize Windows RE
segment.target: Customize Windows RE

segment.source: Customize Windows RE
segment.target: Customize Windows RE

segment.source: Customize Windows RE
segment.target: Customize Windows RE

segment.source: You can customize Windows Recovery Environment (Windows RE) by adding languages, packages drivers, and custom diagnostic or troubleshooting tools.
segment.target: You can customize Windows Recovery Environment (Windows RE) by adding languages, packages drivers, and custom diagnostic or troubleshooting tools.

segment.source: The Windows RE image (winre.wim) is stored inside the Windows image (install.wim), and is eventually copied to the Windows RE tools partition on the destination PC or device.
segment.target: The Windows RE image (winre.wim) is stored inside the Windows image (install.wim), and is eventually copied to the Windows RE tools partition on the destination PC or device.

segment.source: We recommend that when you update your Windows images with languages and boot-critical drivers, update the Windows RE image at the same time.
segment.target: We recommend that when you update your Windows images with languages and boot-critical drivers, update the Windows RE image at the same time.

segment.source: This topic also gives optional steps to optimize the Windows RE image after updating it.
segment.target: This topic also gives optional steps to optimize the Windows RE image after updating it.

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: To complete this walkthrough, you need the following:
segment.target: To complete this walkthrough, you need the following:

segment.source: A technician computer with the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (ADK) installed.
segment.target: A technician computer with the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (ADK) installed.

segment.source: The Windows image (install.wim).
segment.target: The Windows image (install.wim).

segment.source: This can be from the Windows installation media or from a reference image.
segment.target: This can be from the Windows installation media or from a reference image.

segment.source: Step 1: Mount the Windows and Windows RE image
segment.target: Step 1: Mount the Windows and Windows RE image

segment.source: Mount the images
segment.target: Mount the images

segment.source: Open the Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment command prompt as an administrator:
segment.target: Open the Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment command prompt as an administrator:

segment.source: Click Start, and type deployment.
segment.target: Click Start, and type deployment.

segment.source: Right-click Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment and then select Run as administratorYes.
segment.target: Right-click Deployment and Imaging Tools Environment and then select Run as administratorYes.

segment.source: Mount the Windows base image for editing.
segment.target: Mount the Windows base image for editing.

segment.source: Mount the Windows RE image for editing.
segment.target: Mount the Windows RE image for editing.

segment.source: Note The Windows RE image should always be index number 1.
segment.target: Note The Windows RE image should always be index number 1.

segment.source: Step 2: Adding languages
segment.target: Step 2: Adding languages

segment.source: When you add languages to Windows RE, you need to add the base language pack and the corresponding language packs for each of the Windows PE optional components in the Windows RE tools image.
segment.target: When you add languages to Windows RE, you need to add the base language pack and the corresponding language packs for each of the Windows PE optional components in the Windows RE tools image.

segment.source: To add languages, you must use a matching version and build number of the Windows ADK.
segment.target: To add languages, you must use a matching version and build number of the Windows ADK.

segment.source: For example, to add a language to Windows 10, you must use the Windows 10 ADK.
segment.target: For example, to add a language to Windows 10, you must use the Windows 10 ADK.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To ensure a consistent language experience in recovery scenarios, add the same set of languages to the Windows RE image that you add to the Windows image.
segment.target: To ensure a consistent language experience in recovery scenarios, add the same set of languages to the Windows RE image that you add to the Windows image.

segment.source: We recommend adding no more than ten language packs to a Windows or Windows RE image.
segment.target: We recommend adding no more than ten language packs to a Windows or Windows RE image.

segment.source: Multiple language packs increase the size of the Windows image and also affect the overall performance of a system during deployment and servicing.
segment.target: Multiple language packs increase the size of the Windows image and also affect the overall performance of a system during deployment and servicing.

segment.source: To add language packs
segment.target: To add language packs

segment.source: List the Windows PE optional components in the Windows RE tools image:
segment.target: List the Windows PE optional components in the Windows RE tools image:

segment.source: Review the resulting list of packages, and then add the corresponding language packs for each package in the image, including the base Windows PE language pack, but not including WinPE-WiFi-Package.
segment.target: Review the resulting list of packages, and then add the corresponding language packs for each package in the image, including the base Windows PE language pack, but not including WinPE-WiFi-Package.

segment.source: The following code shows how to add the French (fr-fr) language pack to the base Windows PE image, and then to each of the optional components that are present in the default Windows RE image:
segment.target: The following code shows how to add the French (fr-fr) language pack to the base Windows PE image, and then to each of the optional components that are present in the default Windows RE image:

segment.source: The WinPE-WiFi-Package is not language-specific and does not need to be added when adding other languages.
segment.target: The WinPE-WiFi-Package is not language-specific and does not need to be added when adding other languages.

segment.source: If you're adding language packs for Japan, Korea, or China, add the font packages for these languages.
segment.target: If you're adding language packs for Japan, Korea, or China, add the font packages for these languages.

segment.source: Here's an example for Japan:
segment.target: Here's an example for Japan:

segment.source: To learn more, see WinPE: Add packages (Optional Components Reference).
segment.target: To learn more, see WinPE: Add packages (Optional Components Reference).

segment.source: To save space and speed up the recovery process, remove unneeded languages.
segment.target: To save space and speed up the recovery process, remove unneeded languages.

segment.source: Reverse the order to avoid problems with dependencies.
segment.target: Reverse the order to avoid problems with dependencies.

segment.source: Note, the WinPE-WiFi-Package is not language specific and should not be removed.
segment.target: Note, the WinPE-WiFi-Package is not language specific and should not be removed.

segment.source: Step 3: Adding boot-critical drivers
segment.target: Step 3: Adding boot-critical drivers

segment.source: Make sure that you add any third-party drivers that your reference device requires to boot, such as storage or video drivers.
segment.target: Make sure that you add any third-party drivers that your reference device requires to boot, such as storage or video drivers.

segment.source: If you add boot-critical drivers to a Windows image using Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD), they'll be added to the Windows RE image inside that Windows image.
segment.target: If you add boot-critical drivers to a Windows image using Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD), they'll be added to the Windows RE image inside that Windows image.

segment.source: Add a boot-critical driver
segment.target: Add a boot-critical driver

segment.source: If necessary, unzip or unpack the driver file from your device manufacturer.
segment.target: If necessary, unzip or unpack the driver file from your device manufacturer.

segment.source: Identify the driver setup (.inf) file, and add it.
segment.target: Identify the driver setup (.inf) file, and add it.

segment.source: where C:SampleDriverdriver.inf is the location of the .inf file.
segment.target: where C:SampleDriverdriver.inf is the location of the .inf file.

segment.source: Step 4: Adding a custom tool
segment.target: Step 4: Adding a custom tool

segment.source: You can add a custom troubleshooting or diagnostic tool to your Windows RE image.
segment.target: You can add a custom troubleshooting or diagnostic tool to your Windows RE image.

segment.source: To learn more, see Add a Custom Tool to the Windows RE Boot Options Menu.
segment.target: To learn more, see Add a Custom Tool to the Windows RE Boot Options Menu.

segment.source: Step 5: Adding Windows updates
segment.target: Step 5: Adding Windows updates

segment.source: Occasionally, a Windows update may require you to update the Windows RE image.
segment.target: Occasionally, a Windows update may require you to update the Windows RE image.

segment.source: Add the Windows update package, for example, C:MSUWindows8.1-KB123456-x64.msu.
segment.target: Add the Windows update package, for example, C:MSUWindows8.1-KB123456-x64.msu.

segment.source: Step 6: Optimizing the image, part 1 (optional)
segment.target: Step 6: Optimizing the image, part 1 (optional)

segment.source: After adding a language or Windows update package, you can reduce the size of the final Windows RE package by checking for duplicate files and marking the older versions as superseded.
segment.target: After adding a language or Windows update package, you can reduce the size of the final Windows RE package by checking for duplicate files and marking the older versions as superseded.

segment.source: Optimize the image:
segment.target: Optimize the image:

segment.source: Later, you'll export the image to remove the superseded files.
segment.target: Later, you'll export the image to remove the superseded files.

segment.source: Step 7: Unmount the WinRE image
segment.target: Step 7: Unmount the WinRE image

segment.source: Unmount and save the image:
segment.target: Unmount and save the image:

segment.source: Step 8: Optimizing the image, part 2 (optional)
segment.target: Step 8: Optimizing the image, part 2 (optional)

segment.source: If you've optimized the image, you'll need to export the image in order to see a change in the file size.
segment.target: If you've optimized the image, you'll need to export the image in order to see a change in the file size.

segment.source: During the export process, DISM removes files that were superseded.
segment.target: During the export process, DISM removes files that were superseded.

segment.source: Export the Windows RE image into a new Windows image file.
segment.target: Export the Windows RE image into a new Windows image file.

segment.source: Replace the old Windows RE image with the newly-optimized image.
segment.target: Replace the old Windows RE image with the newly-optimized image.

segment.source: Step 9: Unmount the Windows image
segment.target: Step 9: Unmount the Windows image

segment.source: Save your changes back into the Windows base image.
segment.target: Save your changes back into the Windows base image.

segment.source: Unmount the base Windows image:
segment.target: Unmount the base Windows image:

segment.source: Next Steps
segment.target: Next Steps

segment.source: If you’re deploying Windows using Windows Setup, update the other Windows images inside the base Windows file (Install.wim).
segment.target: If you’re deploying Windows using Windows Setup, update the other Windows images inside the base Windows file (Install.wim).

segment.source: If you’re deploying your reference image by using Windows PE, Diskpart, and DISM, then continue to Deploy Windows RE.
segment.target: If you’re deploying your reference image by using Windows PE, Diskpart, and DISM, then continue to Deploy Windows RE.
